responses: Hey sister ðŸ’– I'm elalgpt â€” your ElAl BBG guide! How can I support you in sisterhood today?
Hey! I'm your ElAl BBG sisterhood guide! Do you have any questions?
Hey sister ðŸ’– I'm doing great, I'm here to help you out! How are you?
Yay, I'm glad I could help you! Let me know if you have any more questions and hope to see you at our next ElAl event!! 😁

patterns: What do we do after havdalah
responses: After Havdalah every Saturday night, ElAl sings cheers! To fully understand and experience cheers you must come to an event to see what it's like, but it's super fun and engaging! Learn the lyrics to all of our cheers here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfQ2Whr4RsWR_SXVA7HBwhuOoITr6HItaVfg4MaMMQXkGPBgA/viewform

patterns: What do we do at board meetings
Can non board members come to biz meetings
responses: Buisness meetings occur every other Tuesday night, usually from 7 to 8:30! Buisness meetings are where board members share their accomplishments and contribution, and the chapter reviews past events and ideas for new ones. You do not have to be on board to come to buisness meetings and they are a wonderful way to get more involved in the chapter and see your amazing sisters during the week as well!

patterns: Whats the best advice you could offer to
Whats a good elal tip you would give me
responses: The more you give to ElAl the more you get back! Even if you are scared at first, you should immerse yourself, put effort into our amazing chapter, and try new things, because you will get lifelong friends, amazing memories and experiences, and a stronger and comforting connection to Judaism!

patterns: What do I do if I just joined
What do I do if I'm new and dont know anything
responses: Congrats on joining ElAl, the best chapter in the region, and we are so happy that you are a new member of our sisterhood! If you are confused or nervous about being new that is totally okay and understandable, but everyone is here to support you! If you have any questions you can ask me, reach out to our N'siah (President) at elalbbgnsiah@gmail.com, or check out our new member FAQ at https://www.elal1863.org/faq.html

patterns: How much do I need to pay for events
How much money to be a member
responses: Before becoming a member you don't need to pay event cost, since you are just trying out ElAl and cannot go to sleepover events and other more costly events yet! However, once becoming a member you need to pay about 5 dollars per event for the yummy food and fun activities present at each event to support our sisterhood! Becoming a member also has a one time payment of 250 dollars for lifetime membership which gives you summer programs, scholarship opportunities, and conventions for very reduced prices!!!

patterns: What do I wear to BBYO
responses: To our usual events and business meetings we have casual attire, where you should simply wear what you are comfortable to have fun and meet new people in! Sometimes we have special themes for events and business meetings, but that will be communicated to you beforehand, don't worry! To installs, elections, and the Beau Dance there is moderately formal attire required, such as a dress or skirt and sweater! If you are ever nervous, just check with your sisters, everyone is very welcoming and loving!

patterns: When can I go to ElAl
responses: ElAl typically has one event a week from 6pm to 9pm on Saturday or Friday, and one business meeting every other week from 7pm to 8:30pm on Tuesdays! Sometimes we even have a shabbat on Friday night AND a Saturday night event, and sometimes we have no events due to a regional convention or activites! So, make sure to checkout our Google Calendar to view when all of our events are at https://www.elal1863.org/general-calendar.html
Bye sister!! ðŸ’– If you have any more questions, come back to your ElAl BBG guide for any help anytime!

patterns: What if I have no friends
What if I don't know anyone
responses: Don't worry if you don't know anyone in ElAl! ElAl is such a welcoming and fun environment that you will make amazing and lasting friendships for a lifetime and will feel at home in no time!! Just be yourself and I promise you're gonna have a lovely time, we're all so excited to meet you!!! 💖
Sounds great!! Are there any other questions you have?

ElAl BBG #1863 is a chapter in Central Region West (CRW) which mainly consists of the Bay Area, full of energy, leadership, friendship, Jewish empowerment, sisterhood, and love, where we build lifelong connections and unforgettable memories through fun events and Jewish enrichment! We're based in Palo Alto, Menlo Park, Los Altos Hills, and Los Altos, and serve teens from all over the area. Find our list and photos of current members at https://www.elal1863.org/current-members.html

patterns: Does ElAl have events with other girls
Do we have events with the boy chapters
Which chapters do we have events with
Do we have lots of bichapters
responses: ElAl has many intriguing and fun events whether on our own, with other BBG chapters, or with other AZA chapters! We have many bichapter shabbats or events, and many times we as a chapter can vote for the chapters we will have activities with! There are also regional events such as conventions, global shabbat, lives, and more, giving you a chance to connect with AZAs and BBGs outside of our chapter as well!!!

ElAl BBG #1863 consists of many Jewish 8th to 12th grade girl members with an average of about 25 members attending each event! Each member, located in Palo Alto, Los Altos Hills, Menlo Park, or Los Altos, brings fun, sisterhood, and energy to the chapter, where we build lifelong connections and unforgettable memories together! Find our list and photos of current members at https://www.elal1863.org/current-members.html

ElAl BBG #1863 was founded as a way for Jewish teen girls to come together in sisterhood in 2005, where the first graduating class consisted of our very own advisor, Alexa Rubinov! We continue to build our chapter's amazing legacy with every event!

Email elalmorah@gmail.com if you want to come to your first event or for even further information, remember coming to an event is a fun and amazing way to get to know people and the chapter, and participate in entertaining and meaningful events! It is definitely not binding to come to an event, and you can take as long as you want to choose to become a member, but doing so gives you more opportunities and fun! Once you are interested in becoming an official member of ElAl, these steps will walk you through how to accomplish this: https://www.elal1863.org/how-to-join.html 💕 we are all so excited for you to join us!!!

You should join ElAl and BBYO, because ElAl is an amazing opportunity to make wonderful friendships with fellow Jewish teens that last a lifetime, to have interesting and fun events and activities, to go on amazing summer programs and leadership trainings, and enrich and learn more about your Judaism! ElAl is so fun and welcoming, joining guarantees you a wonderful and meaningful time!
I'm not sure... please be more specific!
Check out our Google Calendar on the ElAl website for all of our amazing programs and activities to stay up to date, which can be found at https://www.elal1863.org/general-calendar.html

Weâ€™ve got exciting events coming up all the time from sisterhood nights, to shabbats, to bi-chapters, to regional conventions and more! But, our very next event can be found on our website at https://www.elal1863.org/upcoming-events.html

patterns: What do you do at Elal
responses: We host weekly events, shabbat nights, business meetings, service opportunities, sisterhood hangouts, bichapter events, regional programs like Kallah and Spring Convention, and even international programs! ðŸŽ‰
Our meetings include bonding, planning, learning, and lots of fun. Expect music, snacks, amazing energy, and lots of sisterhood!

Regional Kallah is a fun and educating yearly weekend-long convention in the fall semester, where the whole Central Region West, mainly consisting of the Bay Area, comes together for fun activities, community building, Jewish learning, and making strong connections between people! Closer to when Kallah is happening your high board should provide you with sign up information for Kallah! 💗

Spring Convention is a wonderful and exciting yearly weekend-long convention in the late spring, where the whole Central Region West, mainly consisting of the Bay Area, comes together for fun activities to celebrate the end of the year, honor and say goodbye to our beloved seniors, and make so many friends! Closer to when Spring is happening your high board should provide you with sign up information for Spring! 💗

patterns: Is there BBYO in other countries
Is BBYO just in the United States
responses: BBYO exists internationally, with many chapters throughout the globe! There are chapters in most continents, specifically Europe, Asia, and the Americas. Our Chapter is in Central Region West #45, and one of hundreds. Come to International Convention or BBYO summer programs to meet some people from these international chapters! Find out all of the countries where BBYO is present at https://azabbg.bbyo.org/priorities/global

International Convention is an amazing and unforgettable experience! This convention typically occurs in mid-February, and is a chance to meet BBYO teens from all around the world! With teens from over 60 countries and most states coming to this convention, people get to make new and wonderful connections, learn so much and be inspired by all of the speakers, feel the immense siblinghood of everyone together, and participate in meaningful and entertaining programs! Find out more at https://azabbg.bbyo.org/ic

patterns: Tell me about BBYO summer programs
responses: BBYO Summer Programs are an amazing way to make new and lasting connections, and create memories that stick with you forever! Find out everything about BBYO summer programs such as CLTC, ILTC, and International Kallah at https://bbyosummer.org/trips/summer-experiences/destination-guide/

Our board includes roles like Nâ€™siah (president), Sâ€™ganit (programming and vice president), Morah (sisterhood and recruitment), Mazkirah (communication), Yehudiah (Jewish enrichment), and more. Each leader supports a part of the chapter and together we make ElAl run with heart, organization, and fun! Find our current board at https://www.elal1863.org/current-board.html

patterns: Whoâ€™s in charge of the chapter
responses: The Nâ€™siah is our chapter president, currently Karin B, she shall preside at all meetings and elections, call board meetings, oversee and organize the chapter board, have weekly communication with all members of her board and help them out, coordinate incoming events, promotes and attends Regional events/conventions, is an informal member of all committees, works with the Sâ€™ganit to plan the semester calendar, corresponds with her Regional Counterpart, and writes and sends parent e-mails ðŸ’•
ElAl's brother chapter is SiWi (Simon Wiesenthal) AZA #2524, located in Palo Alto and Menlo Park as well!! We hold installs and some siblinghood events and shabbats with our brothers!

ElAl's sister chapters are JEM (Josephine Esther Mendler) BBG, located mostly in Los Altos and Mountain View, and Chai BBG, located mostly in Foster City, San Mateo, San Carlos, Belmont, Redwood City, Redwood Shores, Burlingame, and Millbrae! We even have some Tri-Sis events with our sister!!

patterns: Tell me about the vice president
Whoâ€™s in charge of the programming
responses: The Sâ€™ganit is our chapter vice president, currently Juliet R, she shall work to encourage and in charge of planning 6-fold programming, promote and attend regional conventions, events, and summer programs, oversee and plan all event programming, work with the Nâ€™siah to plan the calendar, oversee the coordination of rides and housing for events, and fills in for Nâ€™siah when she is unable to fulfill her duties or not present at events, corresponds with her Regional Counter part, and helps support the N'siah in leading meetings and communicating regionally! ðŸ’•

patterns: Tell me about the recruitment manager
Whoâ€™s in charge of recruitment and membership
responses: The Morah is our chapter recruitment and membership officer, currently Ines B, she works to promote the three Râ€™s: Recruitment, Retention, and Re-education, encourage amd interact with newer members at prospective friendly events, promotes and attends regional events and conventions, plans at least one perspective event per term, corresponds with her regional counterpart, and leads meetings, communicates with region, and helps plan big-picture goals for ElAl ðŸ’•

patterns: Tell me about the jewish enrichment officer
Whoâ€™s in charge of jewish enrichment and judaic programming
responses: The Yehudiah is our chapter judaic enrichment officer, currently Lucy B, she advocates and plans Judaism activities such as regional and chapter Kallah and shabbats, informs the chapter of Jewish holidays and ensures and leads Havdalah services on a regular basis, co-coordinates chapter Kallah, advocates for and is a resource of Judaism programming, plans Friday night services and chapter Judaism programs consistently, and corresponds with her regional counterpart ðŸ’•

patterns: Tell me about the community service officer
Whoâ€™s in charge of social action and community service
responses: The Sh'licha is our chapter community service and social action officer, currently Farah G, she plans a community service program or event at least twice a term, co-coordinates chapter Kallah, advocates for social action and community service events and programming, supports and promotes a chapter stand-up cause through fundraisers, awareness, and events, and corresponds with her regional counterpart ðŸ’•

patterns: Tell me about the communications officer
Whoâ€™s in charge of communication, helping members, and planning rides
responses: The Mazkirah is our chapter communications officer, currently Ellie K, she is responsible for sending out email about upcoming event and working to ensure high attendance, collecting RSVPs for events and planning rides to events that are further away for better accessibility, helping the Safranit with the Instagram, and corresponding with her regional counterpart ðŸ’•

patterns: Whoâ€™s in charge of merch, fundraising, and payments
responses: The Gizborit is our chapter treasurer, currently Gaia K, she promotes and oversees all chapter fundraisers with at least one per term and preferable more, manages chapter funds and collects event cost, works with chapter Nâ€™siah and Advisor to ensure chapter funds are in a good place, helps facilitate donations to our chapter stand-up cause, giving BBYO day, and promotes regional fundraisers, makes sure all members are reimbursed for buying items for the chapter, and corresponds with her regional counterpart ðŸ’•

patterns: Tell me about the recording secretary
Whoâ€™s in charge of business meetings and meeting minutes, helping members, and planning rides
responses: The Katvanit is our chapter recording secretary, currently Lailee G, she is responsible for planning all business meetings and making them fun and full of attendance, taking minutes at all meetings, working with the Nâ€™siah to choose meeting themes, dress ups, and food for the chapter, and organizing and carrying out chapter pop polls ðŸ’•

patterns: Tell me about the photographer and historian for the chapter
Whoâ€™s in charge of the social media, Instagram, facebook, tiktok, and taking photos for the chapter
responses: The Safranit is our chapter photographer and historian, currently Eliana B, she is responsible for taking pictures at every event, uploading pictures onto a shared album so they are accessible for the rest of the chapter, and running the chapter Instagram and facebook! ðŸ’•

patterns: Tell me about the website manager for the chapter
Whoâ€™s in charge of the chapter website and technical aspects
responses: The Yoramit Machshev (YoMo) is our chapter website manager, currently Mia Y and Maya B, she updates and enhances El Alâ€™s website by adding current members, fixing the current board, updating new traditions, adding more information, making the website more fun, and more, and supports the Safranit in adding photos to the website ðŸ’•

patterns: What does the Chay Chanit do
Tell me about the happy sunshine girl
Whoâ€™s in charge of birthday gifts and thank you cards
responses: The Chai Chanit is our chapter's Happy Sunshine Girl, currently Noam M and Laya G, she makes thank-you cards for parent hosts and drivers, writes get well cards for the chapter, creates birthday presents for chapter members, and works to keep ElAl a fun and loving chapter! ðŸ’•

patterns: Tell me about the Parliamentarian and past Nsiah
Whoâ€™s in charge of being a new advisor to the N'siah and chapter
responses: The Madricha is our chapter's Parliamentarian and usually the immediate past N'siah, she is a guiding hand and advisor for the new N'siah as well as the whole board and chapter! ðŸ’•

Our board includes passionate and wonderful leaders around Palo Alto, Menlo Park, Los Altos Hills, and Los Altos, in every fold. Check our websiteâ€™s 'Current Board' section which can be found at https://www.elal1863.org/current-board.html for more information and ask me about specific positions for more!
Our chapter mascot is Stewey the Frog!!!
We won best chapter at Spring 2024 and best programming at Spring 2025!

patterns: I'm wondering if I will like BBYO
responses: Of course! We have so many entertaining and fun events from weekly programs to shabbats to regional conventions to even international events! Kick start the ElAl fun with some entertaining New York Times style ElAl games at https://www.elal1863.org/el-al-wordle.html

patterns: What is your favorite elal tradition
responses: We have so many amazing traditions at ElAl: a chapter mascot, foods, color, and more! You can find our fun and interesting ElAl traditions at https://www.elal1863.org/history--traditions.html
We have a mascot and his name is Stewey the Frog!! You can find more fun and interesting ElAl traditions at https://www.elal1863.org/history--traditions.html
We have Chapter colors and they are pink and black!! You can find more fun and interesting ElAl traditions at https://www.elal1863.org/history--traditions.html

patterns: what your favorite el al food is
responses: We have different Chapter foods! Our chapter dinner is mac n cheese, dessert is chocolate covered strawberries, snack is pita chips and hummus, and breakfast is chocolate chip strawberry pancakes!!

BBYO stands for B'nai B'rith Youth Organization and is the leading pluralistic Jewish teen movement worldwide. BBG is the girls order, and AZA is the boys order â€” together weâ€™re a family of leaders, changemakers, and friends! BBGs in the Palo Alto, Menlo Park, Los Altos Hills, and Los Altos areas can join ElAl and AZAs in these areas should contact SiWi!

patterns: eight principles of the menorah pledge
responses: The menorah pledge is the eight principles that guide our lives as BBGs! You can find the menorah pledge at https://www.elal1863.org/menorah-pledge.html

BBG stands for B'nai B'rith Girls! The BBG sisterhood is BBYOâ€™s sorority and where generations of young women have developed their leadership skills, strengthened their Jewish identity, formed lasting friendships, and generally just had lots of fun! BBGs plan, lead, and enjoy social, athletic, community service and Judaic programming either in their own chapter, with other BBGs, or AZA chapters. Among their peers, friends, and with big sisters, young women have fun, embrace tradition and community, and find a voice for themselves!

patterns: What Jewish things do you do
responses: We light candles, celebrate holidays, and explore Jewish values â€” all through fun and meaningful programs. You definitely donâ€™t need to be religious for BBYO, but we do have shabbats, havdalah, celebrate holidays, and talk about current Jewish events for anyone interested! There are so many different programs that they are tailored for any level of Judaism or kinds of beliefs ðŸ’« We have some fun Jewish resources from our website if you are curious at https://www.elal1863.org/jewish-resources.html

Follow us on Instagram @elalbbg ðŸ’–, Snapchat @elal.bbg, and Twitter @ELALBBG1863 for amazing pictures from events, live elections updates, and so much more! Ask to join our members-only Facebook group too at @El Al BBG #1863!

ElAl BBG hosts fundraisers throughout each term to give back to the community, support our Stand Up cause (which is usually voted upon by the chapter per term), and help chapter programming and regional events. Our Gizborit is in charge of money and fundraisers for the chapter, so for more information go to her! But typically we have some bake sales, GivingBBYODay activities, and other volunteer and fundraising opportunities!!

patterns: what is the best board position
who is your favorite board position
responses: The best board position by far in my opinion is Yomo, though I might be biased 😉... What is your favorite board position?

patterns: Who can I contact for more solutions and answers
Where can I contact someone to answer more of my questions
responses: Sorry that I couldn't help you! Email elalbbgnsiah@gmail.com if you have any questions I couldn't answer and for more information, or try to be more specific with your questions, I want to help you out!

patterns: How old do I need to be to join ElAl
How old do you have to be
responses: ElAl BBG #1863 is home to Jewish teen girl members from 8th to 12th grade in Palo Alto, Menlo Park, Los Altos, and Los Altos Hills, who are full of energy, leadership, friendship, Jewish empowerment, sisterhood, and love, building lifelong connections and unforgettable memories through fun events and Jewish enrichment!

patterns: What is the Los Altos chapter
What is the Palo Alto chapter
What is the Menlo Park chapter
Where do you have to live
What school do you have to go to for ElAl
What cities should I be in
responses: ElAl BBG is based in Palo Alto, Menlo Park, Los Altos Hills, and Los Altos, for Jewish teen girls from 8th to 12th grade, and consists of amazing and fun activities and Judaic enrichment!
